remarks: Definitional property of the ` S.2 ` integral: for any function ` F ` there is a countable sequence ` g ` of simple functions less than ` F ` whose integrals converge to the integral of ` F ` .  (This theorem is for the most part unnecessary in lieu of ~ itg2i1fseq , but unlike that theorem this one doesn't require ` F ` to be measurable.)  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Aug-2014.)
statement:
itg2seq $p |- ( F : RR --> ( 0 [,] +oo ) -> E. g ( g : NN --> dom S.1 /\ A. n e. NN ( g ` n ) oR <_ F /\ ( S.2 ` F ) = sup ( ran ( n e. NN |-> ( S.1 ` ( g ` n ) ) ) , RR* , < ) ) ) $.
$d F g n $.
